sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sacha Greif)
articles.description: In this article, Sacha Greif tries to anticipate future CSS trends and takes a look at some far-fetched and futuristic CSS features that might one day make their way to the browser.
articles.title: Futuristic CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: In this article, Patrick Brosset gives an update on the most impactful new features that are now available in DevTools, across Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Edge.
articles.title: What‚Äôs New In DevTools: Halloween Edition üéÉ

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet Understanding Privacy, our brand new Smashing Book to make sense of privacy, and learn how to create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. eBook now available, print shipping in November.
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: A New Smashing Book Is Here

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Sch√§ferhoff)
articles.description: In this article, Nick Sch√§ferhoff will take a deep dive into WordPress Full-Site Editing, examine the tools it provides for theme development, and provide a tutorial on how to use it to make changes to your site.
articles.title: WordPress Full-Site Editing: A Deep Dive Into The New Feature

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrii Zhdan)
articles.description: In this article about conducting productive meetings, Andrii Zhdan will give you a step-by-step guide on preparing a solid meeting structure that will let you follow the original plan and reach the meeting goals, and he will also share a few tips based on his design experience.
articles.title: Effective Communication For Everyday Meetings

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: Climate change and sustainability are increasing concerns for digital organizations, as well as individuals working in tech. In this article, we‚Äôll explore some of the ways we can raise awareness and effect change within an organization to create a more positive environmental impact.
articles.title: Sustainable Web Development Strategies Within An Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece will show how to create same-document page transitions for Single Page Apps using Shared Element Transitions API and check out its future implementation and potential for creating cross-document transitions in Multi-Page Apps.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devansh Bansal)
articles.description: Owing to tremendous advancements in Machine Learning and other technologies, chatbots have increased in popularity in the past few years. This article will show you, step by step, how to build a chatbot that meets your business goals.
articles.title: A Roadmap For Building A Business Chatbot

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Godwin)
articles.description: Integrate two-factor authentication into your Express.js app by building an application that authenticates users using password-based authentication and OTPs powered by the Twilio Verify service.
articles.title: Node.js Authentication With Twilio Verify

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: We can use the `clamp()` method today because of the great browser support. In this article, Brecht De Ruyte explains how it can be a beautiful addition to your upcoming project or as an upgrade to a previous one.
articles.title: Easy Fluid Typography With clamp() Using Sass Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Shared Element Transitions API is a game-changing feature that will enable us to create impressive and elaborate UI animations easily. In this article, Adrian Bece will explore its incredible potential by building four real-life examples from scratch.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: How about a little inspiration boost? Well, we might have something for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe. They are available in versions with and without a calendar for October and can be downloaded for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: October Vibes For Your Desktop (2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Trina Moore Pervall)
articles.description: Throughout the research and design processes, our unconscious biases are the greatest risk to delivering inclusive experiences. From who we include and exclude in our research to how we plan and conduct research, it‚Äôs crucial that we understand how our unacknowledged biases can perpetuate systems of exclusion.
articles.title: Unconscious Biases That Get In The Way Of Inclusive Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Wix Security Team)
articles.description: In this article, Wix security experts share ten ‚Äúsecurity by design‚Äù principles that emerged from their work in keeping the Wix platform secure. If you‚Äôre a developer, these tried-and-true principles can help you build your own secure applications.
articles.title: Building Your Security Strategy (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Onno Westra)
articles.description: The customer journey is not limited to a website alone. Simply by combining the world of website design and telephony, far better results can be obtained for your organization. And thanks to the similarities and mutual benefits, it is an easy step to take.
articles.title: Phone Numbers For Web Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Agustinus Theodorus)
articles.description: You don‚Äôt need a framework for everything, but if you use one, this article will help you use it in the most performant way.
articles.title: Five Data-Loading Patterns To Boost Web Performance
